intro: Comastoma pulmonarium, commonly known as the lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive purple or pinkish underside. The plant produces tall flowering stems that bear clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink, purple, or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Comastoma pulmonarium is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
